intro: Bupleurum faurelii var. tazzertense, commonly known as the Tazzertense bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
